Authors:
Matteo Gelardi, Claudio Angelini, Federica Costanzo, Enrico
Ercole, Beatriz Ortiz-Santana, Alfredo Vizzini
Title:
Outstanding pinkish brown-spored neotropical boletes:
Austroboletus subflavidus and Fistulinella gloeocarpa (Boletaceae,
Boletales) from the Dominican Republic
Keywords:
Boletales, molecular phylogeny, Greater Antilles,
neotropical boletes, taxonomy
Abstract:
Abstract The occurrence of Austroboletus subflavidus and
Fistulinella gloeocarpa is documented from the Dominican Republic. The
latter species is officially reported for the first time outside its
original locality in Martinique, significantly extending the geographic
range for this uncommon pinkish-spored bolete. A detailed morphological
description is provided for each species and accompanied by color
pictures of fresh basidiomes in habitat and line drawings of the main
anatomical features. Both species represent independent lineages within
their respective genera. In order to confirm the accuracy of species
identification, their identity and relationships have been molecularly
investigated by generating a multilocus phylogenetic inference based on
four gene markers (ITS, 28S rDNA, RPB2, TEF1-Î±) and by comparing the
outcomes with the genetic material already available in public
databases. Austroboletus subflavidus is a widely distributed species in
North and Central America, whereas F. gloeocarpa is apparently highly
localized and seems to appear sparingly in the Dominican Republic.
Comparisons with morphologically similar and molecularly allied species
are also presented and discussed.
